You have dabbled in the spellcasting available to more powerful spellcasters. Your own journey to acquire magical ability is slow, but you have integrated spells into your fighting style in a way few spellcasters can. Choose one of the following classes: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-class.Item.SmG14gsqWBtqmcjt]{Bard}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-class.Item.Z68Q5K5fejrVQZAy]{Cleric}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-class.Item.653LgVa3sG4ek6b5]{Druid}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-class.Item.emEIZZAh0s8Ed62c]{Sorcerer}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-class.Item.whbTNYgkqWV8oGt3]{Warlock}, or @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-class.Item.qM0tUqAZW3V8L4pF]{Wizard}.Your@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.sxKTtNPUrcDvMDFj.JournalEntryPage.arD4KLvgCPbi1Pl7]{spellcasting ability}is based on the class you chose for your spellcasting. Bards, Sorcerers, and Warlocks use&reference[charisma] . Clerics and Druids use&reference[wisdom] . Wizards use&reference[intelligence] .

Spellswords are &reference[knownspells]{known spellcasters}, even if the class they chose for spellcasting isn't. The Spellsword Spellcasting Table (shown below) shows how many spell slots you have, as well as how many cantrips and spells you know. You can search the @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.vaLYevRxKe8mAvdE]{list of spells by class here}.

Spellcasting Focuses

You can use a spellcasting focus, component pouch, or a weapon as a@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.sxKTtNPUrcDvMDFj.JournalEntryPage.R25K8TvAPK3c4ywr]{spellcasting focus}. To do so, you need a free hand to hold your focus or access your components.
